discussion.content:
Correct answer should be 'B'.
In the PRINCE2 project management methodology, sending a project closure notification to suppliers is a standard step in the project closure process. This notification informs suppliers of the closure of the project and any associated administrative procedures, such as invoicing deadlines. It is the responsibility of the project manager to ensure that all necessary communications, including notifications to suppliers, are issued as part of closing the project.

This one is confusing for me.. i can see many people referring to page 372 but in the page 267-268 under 20.4.5. recommend project closure section, it states that draft project closure notification prepared by project manager sent for review to project board for their approval. So then the correct answer seems to be A to me. But if you take the page 372 and 191 as a reference then C is the most suitable answer

comments.content:
Also on Page 372 
closure recommendation
A recommendation prepared by the project manager for the project board to send as a project closure notification when the board is satisfied that the project can be closed

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Sending project closure notification is done by project board after reviewing the draft notification submitted by PM. 
Page 191 . Activity - Authorize project closure. Process - Directing A Project

The correct answer is B. Yes, because a project closure notification should be sent to suppliers as part of the ‘closing project’ process.

In PRINCE2, the ‘Closing a Project’ process is designed to provide a fixed point at which acceptance for the project product is confirmed, and to recognize that objectives set out in the original Project Initiation Documentation have been achieved (or approved changes to the objectives have been achieved), or that the project has nothing more to contribute.

Selected Answer: A
Would the board be taking care of this admin stuff? makes more sense to be PM

C is correct -- Refer to page 372 
Project board should issue the closure notification

questions.question_text:
The Health and Safety Training Project is closing as planned. According to the contract terms, suppliers must submit all invoices within one week of project closure. The project manager will issue a project closure notification informing all suppliers of this invoicing deadline as part of the 'recommended project closure' activity.
Is this appropriate, and why?

choices.C: No, because the project board should issue a project closure notification as part of the 'directing a project' process.
choices.D: No, because the project manager should notify stakeholders using the approved project closure notification.
choices.B: Yes, because a project closure notification should be sent to suppliers as part of the 'closing project' process.
choices.A: Yes, because the project board should approve the project closure notification drafted by the project manager.

choices.B: Yes, because team plans are mandatory on a project of this size and complexity.
choices.A: Yes, because a supplier may want to keep the details of the specialist work confidential.
choices.C: No, because the project manager needs detailed plans to manage the work of several teams.
choices.D: No, because the team plan must be submitted to project assurance to check it is viable.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
Refer Page 238 
Seek necessary approval for the team plan (although in a commercial customer/supplier relationship it may be inappropriate for the project manager to review and approve the team plan and, in such a context, the senior supplier may review and approve the team plans)

C is the correct answer.

No, because the project manager needs detailed plans to manage the work of several teams.

The project manager has responsibility for coordinating and directing the work of all teams delivering products in the stage. To exercise effective control, the project manager needs to review and approve the detailed plans for each team's work.

questions.question_text:
The project is at the start of stage 3, and there will be six teams working on product delivery. In order to exercise control, the project manager has asked each team to submit a detailed team plan for approval. The external team manager for the 'e-learning course' has agreed to submit a summary to the project manager, but will submit the detailed team plan to the senior supplier to review and approve.
Is the team manager's response appropriate, and why?

There is a threat that the early release of a competitor's calendar may weaken the impact of the MNO Manufacturing Company calendar, thereby reducing the anticipated benefits of the Calendar project.
